summary: characterized 24 new marsupial-related viruses from fecal samples collected from captive and wild devils. these findings broaden our understanding of the diversity of viruses infecting this evolutionarily unique group of mammals. atovaquone, a commonly used antiparasitic agent, inhibits Zika virus replication in vitro and ex vivo in human placental explants. this study highlights the importance of reexamining pregnancy-acceptable drugs with potential antiviral activities against emerging viral threats.
